subject: [ANN] Java Gui Builder version 0.1a released on SourceForge !
msgSnippet: Hello everyone ! This is to announce the first release of the Java Gui Builder.  This project aims at separating the GUI construction code from the mainstream
messageBody:
Hello everyone !

This is to announce the first release of the Java Gui Builder. This project
aims at separating the GUI construction code from the mainstream code. The GUI
is described in an external XML file. This way, even end-users can modify the
GUI layout to fit their needs :)

I am posting this message to this list for four reasons:
1. I developped the software through Test-First Design. This list endorses
Test-First Design, so I tought this would be a nice place to build awareness :)

2. I am searching for opinions, comments, encouragements and disapprovals on
whether or not this project would be useful. I am specifically searching for
opinions on the DTD and associated examples.

3. I have the LinkageError during the test phase of the build process (using
Ant/JUnit task). I was wondering if anyone would care to take a look ? The
included /lib folder contains the junit.jar that I use. The
excluded.properties file contains the proper exclusion. Maybe I am missing
something else ?

4. My example files contain a reference to the DTD, but it seems that the path
may not be relative. So, I am looking for a bit of help on that too.

Please bear in mind that this is a first ever alpha release, so, there is still
lot's of documentation that is missing. The DTD and the
examples/simplewindow.xml files contain comments on the building process
itself. You may read them for more information.

The download contains both the source code and the executable files.

This software is licensed under the GPL.

To access the project's Summary page, browse to
http://sourceforge.net/projects/jgb/.

For the project's home page, browse to http://jgb.sourceforge.net/.

Thank you !
Francois Beausoleil
